summary: Generic title 'Book Reviews' appears 22 times across different journals - short titles inflate Jaccard scores and cause unrelated journal sections to be flagged as duplicates
notes: Classic generic title collision. Title is 2 tokens, Jaccard is 1.0. These are valid Crossref DOIs for journal back matter sections. Different publishers, different journals, same year, same generic title. Other examples from dataset: 'Editorial Board' (14 instances), 'Preface' (12), 'Announcements' (10), 'Frontmatter' (14), 'Issue Information' (6). Current system correctly marked as MEDIUM confidence (not HIGH), but should probably be UNSEARCHABLE or require journal+volume+issue match for deduplication.
